name: Cuphea
relationship: Compare: Aethusa; COTO - Para-cot Bark - (intestinal catarrh, chronic, copious, exhausting diarrhoea and dysentery; colliquative sweats of phthisis and chronic diarrhoea.) TYPHA LATIFOLIA - Cat-tail flag (diarrhoea, dysentery, summer complaint of children. Tincture and first attenuation.)
details: Vomiting of undigested food. CHOLERA INFANTUM, much acidity; frequent green, watery, acid stools. Tenesmus and great pain. High fever; restlessness, and sleeplessness. Obstinate constipation.
